page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: The oldest house in the village is one called The Old Guild Hall. It has three storeys and was built about 400 years ago. The other old houses in the village are only 200 and 300 years old. Most of the old houses have had a considerable amount more built on to them with more modern materials. For instance most of the old houses roofs have been replaced with tiles where they were thatched. There are some houses which are thatched because the owners prefer it in order to make it look prettier. When the older houses were built they were thatched because tiles were too expensive. In fact only rich people could afford them. There are two housing estates in Gislingham, one of bungalows and the other of one and two storey buildings. Both were built in the last 20 years.
